title: Lower Chinese, Indian voter turnout a factor in PH's Sungai Bakap state by-election defeat, says Chow
summary: A decline of between 10% and 13% in turnout among Chinese and Indian voters was a factor in Pakatan Harapan's (PH) loss in the Sungai Bakap state by-election on Saturday, said Penang PH chairman Chow Kon Yeow.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (July 6): A decline of between 10% and 13% in turnout among Chinese and Indian voters was a factor in Pakatan Harapan's (PH) loss in the Sungai Bakap state by-election on Saturday, said Penang PH chairman Chow Kon Yeow.

He said the lower voter turnout caused the coalition to lose a significant number of Chinese and Indian votes compared to the state election in August last year.

"The lower turnout somewhat caused us to lose up to 1,000 to 2,000

title: Govt to look into black smoke emissions from Port Dickson crude oil refinery
summary: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Sustainability (NRES), through the Department of Environment (DOE), received a complaint about the emission of black smoke at a crude oil refinery in Port Dickson on June 19.
content:
SEREMBAN (July 6): The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Sustainability (NRES), through the Department of Environment (DOE), received a complaint about the emission of black smoke at a crude oil refinery in Port Dickson on June 19.

The ministry said in a statement that the emission of black smoke resulted in air pollution, and disturbed residents of nearby housing areas, including Taman Toh Kee Kah and Taman Mewah.

"Based on DOE investigations on t

title: MACC arrests company director over false claims of RM527,375
summary: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has arrested a company director for submitting suspected false claims worth RM527,375.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has arrested a company director for submitting suspected false claims worth RM527,375.

An MACC source said the man, in his 40s, was arrested at 3pm on Friday around Kuala Terengganu.

“The suspect was believed to have committed the offence around 2016 by submitting false payment claims, including reciepts and bank statements for paddy equipment purchases to a government agency to obtain a

title: 'Al-Falah' concept brings benefits to people, religion, country, says Fadillah
summary: The concept of 'Al-Falah' featured in this year's Maal Hijrah 2024/1446 theme is crucial for ensuring societal success, benefiting the people, religion and country, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): The concept of 'Al-Falah' featured in this year's Maal Hijrah 2024/1446 theme is crucial for ensuring societal success, benefiting the people, religion and country, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.

He said this year's Maal Hijrah theme, 'Al-Falah Pemacu Malaysia Madani', highlights 'Falah', which by definition means success.

"The beginning of Muharram, or Maal Hijrah, is significant as it commemorates the historic Isla

title: Prolintas reiterates it fulfilled all verified, certified payment obligations to DASH contractors, nothing to do with subcontractors' plight
summary: Projek Lintasan Kota Holdings Sdn Bhd (Prolintas), the holding company of Projek Lintasan Damansara-Shah Alam Sdn Bhd (PLDASH), reiterated on Saturday that it had fulfilled all verified and certified payment obligations to the work package contractors (WPCs) involved in the Damansara-Shah Alam Elevated Expressway (DASH) project according to their respective contracts.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): Projek Lintasan Kota Holdings Sdn Bhd (Prolintas), the holding company of Projek Lintasan Damansara-Shah Alam Sdn Bhd (PLDASH), reiterated on Saturday that it had fulfilled all verified and certified payment obligations to the work package contractors (WPCs) involved in the Damansara-Shah Alam Elevated Expressway (DASH) project according to their respective contracts.

In a statement released to the media on Saturday, Prolintas said t

title: PN retains Sungai Bakap state seat with wider margin
summary: Perikatan Nasional (PN) has managed to retain the Sungai Bakap state seat in Penang as its candidate Abidin Ismail emerged victorious in the by-election with a 4,267-vote margin over Pakatan Harapan candidate Dr Joohari Ariffin.

title: MACC forms special team to investigate HRD Corp
summary: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has formed a special investigation team to scrutinise the documents provided by the Ministry of Human Resources (MOHR) regarding issues involving the Human Resource Development Corporation (HRD Corp).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has formed a special investigation team to scrutinise the documents provided by the Ministry of Human Resources (MOHR) regarding issues involving the Human Resource Development Corporation (HRD Corp).

In a statement on Saturday, deputy chief commissioner (operations) Datuk Seri Ahmad Khusairi Yahaya stated that the information and documents related to the Auditor General’s Report on HRD Corp, received from MOHR secretary general Datuk

title: Loke welcomes Zahid's statement to strengthen unity govt for GE16
summary: DAP has welcomed Barisan Nasional (BN) chairman Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi's willingness to collaborate with Pakatan Harapan (PH) to strengthen the unity government in facing the 16th general election (GE16).
content:
SEREMBAN (July 6): DAP has welcomed Barisan Nasional (BN) chairman Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi's willingness to collaborate with Pakatan Harapan (PH) to strengthen the unity government in facing the 16th general election (GE16).

DAP secretary general Anthony Loke Siew Fook said the statement of intent also showed Zahid's commitment to efforts to strengthen political stability and ensure the country's prosperity.

 "Yes, we always hold discussions, but h

title: Polling ends, vote-tallying begins for Sungai Bakap state by-election
summary: The voting process for the Sungai Bakap state by-election concluded on Saturday after all nine polling centres, which opened at 8am, officially closed at 6pm.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (July 6): The voting process for the Sungai Bakap state by-election concluded on Saturday after all nine polling centres, which opened at 8am, officially closed at 6pm.

The voting centres involved were Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan (SMK) Tasek, Sekolah Jenis Kebangsaan Cina Boon Beng, SMK Bandar Tasek Mutiara, Sekolah Kebangsaan (SK) Seri Tasek, SK Sungai Duri, SMK Tun Syed Sheh Barakbah, SK Sungai Bakap, SK Jawi, and SK Sungai Kechil.

Immed

title: Malaysia's halal exports hit RM54b in 2023, says Zafrul
summary: The value of Malaysia's halal exports reached RM54 billion in 2023, said Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz.
content:
KUANTAN (July 6): The value of Malaysia's halal exports reached RM54 billion in 2023, said Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz.

He said the halal industry plays a vital role as a catalyst for the country's economic growth, and the sector had tremendous potential to grow as the global halal industry, including both products and services, is expected to hit US$5 trillion (RM23.54 trillion) by 2030.

The minister said that the

title: Oil spill detected at Port Klang
summary: The Selangor Water Management Authority (LUAS) detected an oil spill at the Jalan Tangki flood gate in Port Klang near here at around 11am on Friday.
content:
SHAH ALAM (July 6): The Selangor Water Management Authority (LUAS) detected an oil spill at the Jalan Tangki flood gate in Port Klang near here at around 11am on Friday.

Based on observations at the location, the oil spill is believed to have originated from a leaking hose at a factory’s palm oil storage facility, LUAS said.

“The leak is believed to have caused oil to spill into the drain at the premises, which flowed into the nearby canal.

title: Sarawak has game development potential — deputy digital minister
summary: Sarawak, which is rich in cultural heritage and rapidly growing in the technological scene, has great potential in the global gaming industry and to become a world hub for game development innovation, said Deputy Digital Minister Datuk Wilson Ugak Anak Kumbong.
content:
SIBU (July 6): Sarawak, which is rich in cultural heritage and rapidly growing in the technological scene, has great potential in the global gaming industry and to become a world hub for game development innovation, said Deputy Digital Minister Datuk Wilson Ugak Anak Kumbong.

He said Sarawak has the chance to mix traditional wisdom with modern innovation in creating games that are appealing to the world while staying true to the Sarawak roots.

“Th

title: Melaka exco urges expedited construction of waste-to-energy plant
summary: The Melaka government is urging for the construction of the waste-to-energy (WTE) plant at the Sungai Udang Sanitary Landfill to be expedited, as the tender was awarded over two years ago.
content:
MELAKA (July 6): The Melaka government is urging for the construction of the waste-to-energy (WTE) plant at the Sungai Udang Sanitary Landfill to be expedited, as the tender was awarded over two years ago.

State Housing, Local Government, Drainage, Climate Change, and Disaster Management chairman Datuk Rais Yasin emphasised that the WTE plant or incinerator is urgently needed to extend the lifespan of the landfill, which is expected to be full by March 2026.

title: Malaysia's priority is repatriation of 1MDB assets — home minister
summary: The government is focusing on the recovery of 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) assets, following the settlement agreement between the US Department of Justice (DOJ) and fugitive Low Taek Jho, also known as Jho Low, said Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (July 6): The government is focusing on the recovery of 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) assets, following the settlement agreement between the US Department of Justice (DOJ) and fugitive Low Taek Jho, also known as Jho Low, said Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail.

“When our national assets are returned to the DOJ, our focus is on asset repatriation,” he said at a press conference after officiating the Police Day Run here on Saturday.

W

title: Proposals related to palm oil windfall profit levy to be submitted to MOF before Budget 2025, says Johari Ghani
summary: The Ministry of Plantation and Commodities will collect data related to the costs involved from all players in the palm oil industry before any decision regarding the windfall profit levy (WPL) on palm oil in this country is sent to the Ministry of Finance (MOF).
content:
TAIPING (July 6): The Ministry of Plantation and Commodities will collect data related to the costs involved from all players in the palm oil industry before any decision regarding the windfall profit levy (WPL) on palm oil in this country is sent to the Ministry of Finance (MOF).

Plantation and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani said all proposals related to the matter would be sent to the MOF before the tabling of Budget 2025.

“We made an avera

title: Prolintas says "no basis in law" DASH subcontractors claims in seeking to recover over RM100mil
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Projek Lintasan Kota Holdings Sdn Bhd (Prolintas) says that the claims and allegations by 20 DASH subcontractors in seeking to recover over RM100 million have "no basis in law". This is given that in court orders issued in 2021, the ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Projek Lintasan Kota Holdings Sdn Bhd (Prolintas) says that the claims and allegations by 20 DASH subcontractors in seeking to recover over RM100 million have "no basis in law". 

This is given that in court orders issued in 2021, the subcontractors had agreed, among others, that there was no contractual relationship between them and the DASH project employer, and that all allegations made against the DASH project employer were withdrawn unconditionally.

Prolintas is the holding company of Projek Lintasan Dam

title: Sungai Bakap state by-election: 38.3% voter turnout as of 1pm
summary: Polling for the Sungai Bakap state by-election kicked off at 8am on Saturday, and 38.3% of the 39,222 registered ordinary voters had come out to vote as of 1pm, according to the Election Commission (EC).
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (July 6): Polling for the Sungai Bakap state by-election kicked off at 8am on Saturday, and 38.3% of the 39,222 registered ordinary voters had come out to vote as of 1pm, according to the Election Commission (EC).  

EC chairman Datuk Seri Ramlan Harun, who was just appointed on June 26, said the voting process had been going on smoothly, with no serious incidents reported so far.  

“I hope that all the voters who are registe

title: Govt to review overlapping functions of foreign worker management systems after PAC findings
summary: The government will conduct further review concerning the two foreign worker management systems alleged to have overlapping functions, as revealed by the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) on Wednesday.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (July 6): The government will conduct further review concerning the two foreign worker management systems alleged to have overlapping functions, as revealed by the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) on Wednesday.

Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said that the Home Ministry (KDN) is looking into it and examining the PAC’s findings regarding the two systems.

“It is our obligation to improve current practices. We will make every effort to e

title: Sarawak premier hints at formalising Affin Bank deal on July 19
summary: Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg has indicated that there will be an official signing ceremony for Sarawak to acquire a major stake in “a bank” — widely understood to be Affin Bank Bhd (KL:AFFIN) — on July 19.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg has indicated that there will be an official signing ceremony for Sarawak to acquire a major stake in “a bank” — widely understood to be Affin Bank Bhd (KL:AFFIN) — on July 19.

The premier, at a press conference for an event in Kuching on Friday, said Sarawak is set to take over a major block of a bank’s shares, which would pave the way for it to become a dominant player in the Malaysian banking landscape, according to the Dayak Daily.

title: Encouraging turnout of young voters for Sungai Bakap state by-election, says EC
summary: The percentage of voter turnout among young people in the Sungai Bakap state election on Saturday morning was encouraging, said Election Commission (EC) chairman Datuk Seri Ramlan Harun.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (July 6): The percentage of voter turnout among young people in the Sungai Bakap state election on Saturday morning was encouraging, said Election Commission (EC) chairman Datuk Seri Ramlan Harun. 

Based on observation of the voting process at three polling centres, he said the voting pattern saw the youth streams being filled the most.

"This is the third school, and I find the situation is calm, and the voting process is going smooth

title: Zahid: Mara Inc to ensure no recurrence of loss as shown in AG's Report
summary: The Ministry of Rural and Regional Development will resolve the RM286.30 million loss of Mara Incorporated Sdn Bhd (Mara Inc) highlighted in the Auditor General's Report and ensure it does not recur, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.
content:
PASIR MAS (July 6): The Ministry of Rural and Regional Development will resolve the RM286.30 million loss of Mara Incorporated Sdn Bhd (Mara Inc) highlighted in the Auditor General's Report and ensure it does not recur, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.

Zahid, who is also the rural and regional development minister, said that although the process of recovering these losses will take some time, he will ensure there is no breach of trust, misappropriation or abuse of power wi

title: Co-payment requirements for medical and health insurance and takaful products to promote sustainability, affordability — BNM
summary: Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM) clarified on Saturday recent commentaries related to the implementation of co-payment requirements for medical and health insurance and takaful (MHIT) products, saying it aims to promote sustainability and affordability.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM) clarified on Saturday recent commentaries related to the implementation of co-payment requirements for medical and health insurance and takaful (MHIT) products, saying it aims to promote sustainability and affordability.

“The Policy Document on Medical and Health Insurance/Takaful Business aims to promote more sustainable and affordable MHIT offerings amid continued increase in medical cost inflation,” it said.

title: Gamuda Luge to support Selangor's 7.0mil tourist target: Menteri Besar
summary: RAWANG: Gamuda Bhd's Gamuda Luge Gardens is reinforcing Selangor's position as a premier tourist destination, Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari said.He said the addition of Gamuda Luge Gardens, featuring the first-ever Skyline Luge in Malaysia and ...
content:
RAWANG: Gamuda Bhd's Gamuda Luge Gardens is reinforcing Selangor's position as a premier tourist destination, Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari said.

He said the addition of Gamuda Luge Gardens, featuring the first-ever Skyline Luge in Malaysia and a vibrant entertainment hub in the northern Klang Valley corridor, is expected to boost tourist arrivals in the state.

"Last year, Selangor welcomed 6.54 million tourists. With these new attractions, it supports the state to achieving our target of 7. 0 million

title: Bursa's 1H average daily trading value up 59% to RM3.27b — CEO
summary: Bursa Malaysia’s average daily trading value surged 59% to RM3.27 billion in the first half of the year (1H2024), from RM2.06 billion for the same corresponding period in 2023, showing that trading on the equity market is thriving.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): Bursa Malaysia’s average daily trading value surged 59% to RM3.27 billion in the first half of the year (1H2024), from RM2.06 billion for the same corresponding period in 2023, showing that trading on the equity market is thriving.

Bursa Malaysia Bhd (KL:BURSA) chief executive officer Datuk Muhamad Umar Swift said the FBM KLCI benchmark index crossed the psychological 1,600-point mark in early May — the highest level in two years, and continued to dynamically move between

title: The Week Ahead: Attention on AG’s Report debate, Bank Negara’s monetary policy meeting and Johor Plantations’ IPO
summary: Lawmakers will debate the latest Auditor-General’s (AG) Report 2/2024 when parliament resumes session this week following a one-day break for Awal Muharram on Monday.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 8, 2024 - July 14, 2024

Lawmakers will debate the latest Auditor-General’s (AG) Report 2/2024 when parliament resumes session this week following a one-day break for Awal Muharram on Monday.

The Dewan Rakyat is expected to witness heated debates between members of parliament on both sides of the political divide after the AG’s Report released last week fo

title: South Malaysia Industries looks to use market manipulation law to compel PO to reveal details of trade in shares
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: South Malaysia Industries Bhd (SMI), in arguably the first case of its kind in the country, has gone to court to compel a "participating organisation" (PO) to disclose further details of certain selling shareholders it represents.SMI is ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: South Malaysia Industries Bhd (SMI), in arguably the first case of its kind in the country, has gone to court to compel a "participating organisation" (PO) to disclose further details of certain selling shareholders it represents.

SMI is looking to compel the PO, Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga IB), to provide further details of the sellers pertaining to a change in its substantial shareholder, as the former believes that there is a possible breach of Section 176 of Capital Markets and Services Act 2007.

summary: KUALA LUMPUR: South Malaysia Industries Bhd (SMI), in arguably the first case of its kind in the country, has gone to court to compel a "participating organisation" (PO) to disclose further details of certain selling shareholders it represents,SMI compelled ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: South Malaysia Industries Bhd (SMI), in arguably the first case of its kind in the country, has gone to court to compel a "participating organisation" (PO) to disclose further details of certain selling shareholders it represents,

SMI compelled the PO, Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga IB), to provide further details of the sellers pertaining to a change in its substantial shareholder, as the former believes that there is a possible breach of Section 176 of Capital Markets and Services Act 2007.

title: Sungai Bakap state by-election: Nine polling stations open at 8am
summary: Nine polling centres with 65 voting streams opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday for the Sungai Bakap state by-election.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (July 6): Nine polling centres with 65 voting streams opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday for the Sungai Bakap state by-election.

They are at Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan (SMK) Tasek, Sekolah Jenis Kebangsaan Cina Boon Beng, SMK Bandar Tasek Mutiara, Sekolah Kebangsaan (SK) Seri Tasek, SK Sungai Duri, SMK Tun Syed Sheh Barakbah, SK Sungai Bakap, SK Jawi, and SK Sungai Kechil.

 All the polling centres will be closed

title: Shenanigans at HRD Corp
summary: The Public Accounts Committee’s (PAC) inquiry into the affairs of the Human Resource Development Corporation (HRD Corp), particularly its investments and governance structure, has opened a can of worms.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 6): The Public Accounts Committee’s (PAC) inquiry into the affairs of the Human Resource Development Corporation (HRD Corp), particularly its investments and governance structure, has opened a can of worms.

HRD Corp, which celebrated its 30th anniversary last year, was formed in 1993 to fund the upskilling of employees on the basis that companies were not spending enough to develop their human capital. In relation to the objective, the government agency began collecting from registered

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Earnings to test hopes for broader rally
summary: Hopes that the US stocks rally will broaden beyond megacaps like Nvidia will be tested in coming weeks as investors learn whether profit growth from other companies is starting to catch up with that of the tech-related leaders.
content:
Investors will be watching whether profits from other companies are catching up with the "Magnificent 7". — Bloomberg

NEW YORK: Hopes that the US stocks rally will broaden beyond megacaps like Nvidia will be tested in coming weeks as investors learn whether profit growth from other companies is starting to catch up with that of the tech-related leaders.

title: Oil settles lower as supply disruption concerns ease
summary: Oil prices settled lower on Friday as the rising possibility of a ceasefire deal in Gaza outweighed strong summer fuel demand and potential supply disruptions from Gulf of Mexico hurricanes.
content:
Brent crude futures settled down 89 cents, or 1.02% lower, to US$86.54 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures settled at US$83.16 a barrel, down 72 cents, or 0.9%.

HOUSTON: Oil prices settled lower on Friday as the rising possibility of a ceasefire deal in Gaza outweighed strong summer fuel demand and potential supply disruptions from Gulf of Mexico hurricanes.

Brent crude futures settle

title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 hit record highs on payrolls data
summary: Wall Street stock indexes closed firmer on Friday, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq and benchmark S&P 500 hitting record highs, as new data showing US labour market weakness boosted expectations for interest rate cuts as early as September.
content:
The Dow rose 67.87 points, or 0.17%, to close at 39,375.87. The S&P 500 gained 30.17 points, or 0.54%, at 5,567.19 and the Nasdaq advanced 164.46 points, or 0.90%, to 18,352.76.

NEW YORK: Wall Street stock indexes closed firmer on Friday, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq and benchmark S&P 500 hitting record highs, as new data showing US labour market weakness boosted expectations for interest rate cuts as ear

title: Navigating the inflation challenge
summary: Malaysia fisherman Zainal, 50, is still enjoying subsidised diesel, which remained unchanged at RM1.65 per litre. But he, who feeds a family of five, is getting concerned about his rising cost of living, as other expenses for basic food items, fishing nets and auto services have gone up.
content:
MALAYSIAN fisherman Zainal, 50, is still enjoying subsidised diesel, which remained unchanged at RM1.65 per litre. But he, who feeds a family of five, is getting concerned about his rising cost of living, as other expenses for basic food items, fishing nets and auto services have gone up.

This is the real impact of inflationary pressures following the government’s recent move to rationalise diesel subsidies. Rolling back subsi

title: Global war on inflation sees progress
summary: The fight against inflation appears to be bearing fruit in some parts the world.
content:
Socio-Economic Research Centre economist and executive director Lee Heng Guie.

THE fight against inflation appears to be bearing fruit in some parts the world.

There are some data points and comments coming from central banks around the world which point to the direction that inflation globally appears to be brought under some semblance of control following price flares that were seen one to two years ago

title: Pos Malaysia banking on transformation
summary: For some time now, beleaguered Pos Malaysia Bhd has been attempting to change its fortunes through various transformation strategies.
content:
Steady hand: Brewer is helming the postal service provider’s diversification into sectors such as retail and software as a service.

title: The future consumer
summary: Rising costs and inflation are not going to stop consumers from splurging and companies need to pay more attention to cater to the youth and older demographic segments.
content:
RISING costs and inflation are not going to stop consumers from splurging and companies need to pay more attention to cater to the youth and older demographic segments.

Younger consumers are more optimistic about the economy and are willing to spend, while older consumers are splurging and brand loyalty seems to be a thing of the past.

title: Struggling to make use of boom in energy storage
summary: Rows of what look like thin, white shipping containers are lined up on a barren dirt field in China’s Shandong province.
content:

ROWS of what look like thin, white shipping containers are lined up on a barren dirt field in China’s Shandong province.

title: Greater oversight on developers needed
summary: The property sector is a key pillar of the Malaysian economy, as the growth of the sector itself has a positive spillover impact on many industries, including banking, building materials and construction, as well as service providers like interior designers, landscapers, property managers, valuers and other professionals like lawyers, quantity surveyors and architects.
content:
Perhaps it is time to look at the other spectrum of the property market – sick, delayed, and abandoned (SDA) housing projects.

title: Indonesia’s elusive quest for economic expansion
summary: In a recent interview, Indonesia president-elect Prabowo Subianto told Bloomberg of his goal of achieving an 8% growth rate within the next three to five years.
content:
Over the past decade, Indonesia’s average growth has been just 5.07% (excluding during the 2020-2022 pandemic). — The Jakarta Post

IN a recent interview, Indonesia president-elect Prabowo Subianto told Bloomberg of his goal of achieving an 8% growth rate within the next three to five years.

While ambitious, escaping the middle-income trap requires a growth rate of at least 6% within a very narrow window u
